title: Teen hospitalised with life-threatening injuries after student halls balcony fall
text:

A 19-year-old man is fighting for his life in hospital after plunging from the balcony of a student hall in Nottingham.

Police officers have taped off the halls in Nottingham city centre after the young man's fall early this morning.

Emergency services were called at around 348am to the scene, and the man was rushed to hospital with life-threatening injuries, police said.

The second floor balcony area of Nottingham Trent University's Hampden student halls has been taped off in a number of areas following the incident, reports Nottinghamshire Live .

A cordon has been put up in Hampden Street and officers remained at the scene this afternoon.

(Image: BPM Media)

A Nottinghamshire Police spokesman said: "A 19-year-old man has been taken to hospital with life-threatening injuries after falling from the balcony of a property in Nottingham.

"We were called to Hampden Street at 3.48am today.

"A scene has been set up while we continue with our enquiries.

"At this time we are not treating the incident as suspicious.

The man's family has been informed.

"If anyone has any information about the incident we'd ask them to call Nottinghamshire Police on 101, quoting incident number 115 of 5 October 2019."
description: The young man plunged from a balcony at Nottingham Trent University's Hampden student halls
